mal:area.name: PlanningDataTypes
mal:area.comment: This section details the data types used in the planning and other planning related services, such as automation. This section does not contain services. The structures are defined in terms of the MO MAL. The PlanningDataTypes area has a short form number of '6'.

mal:composite.name: ArgumentDefinitionDetails
mal:composite.comment: The ArgumentDefinitionDetails structure holds the details of an argument definition with a set of associated attributes. Nested/recursive definitions are not allowed. The 'value' of an argument is in AttributeValue. The value is expected to be one of MAL:Attribute primitive data types. Structures as values are not supported, although a workaround is to encode the value in a string, delimited with '|' (pipes), for example.

mal:field.name: name
mal:field.comment: The name of the argument definition. Must not be empty or the wildcard value.

mal:field.name: description
mal:field.comment: This field may be used to add remarks about the argument.

mal:field.name: attributeType
mal:field.comment: Holds the attribute short form part of the type of the argument, e.g., for a MAL::String argument it shall hold 15. May be used for checking the attribute type.

mal:field.name: unit
mal:field.comment: The unit of an argument, if applicable.

mal:field.name: representation
mal:field.comment: The representation of an argument, if applicable. Possible values may be 'Raw', 'Converted'.

mal:field.name: radix
mal:field.comment: Radix for argument value, if applicable. Possible values may be 'Decimal', 'Hexadecimal', 'Octal'.

mal:field.name: defaultValue
mal:field.comment: Default value of an argument.

mal:composite.name: AttributeValue
mal:composite.comment: The AttributeValue structure holds an Attribute value. It allows a list of different Attribute types to be created whereas List<Attribute> would require the values to be all of the same type.

mal:field.name: value
mal:field.comment: The argument value. Must not be NULL. NULL may be represented by having a NULL in place of the complete AttributeValue composite. The structure is identical to the MC AttributeValue.

mal:composite.name: StatusRecord
mal:composite.comment: The StatusRecord structure holds information related to a field in a status object. Example status object is a planning request status.

mal:field.name: state
mal:field.comment: The state name for which this record is applicable.

mal:field.name: timeStamp
mal:field.comment: Absolute date and time of the record.

mal:field.name: comment
mal:field.comment: Comment for the record.

mal:composite.name: TriggerDetails
mal:composite.comment: The TriggerDetails structure holds the synchronization information related to tasks and activities. An example is a task or activity start time. There are two types of task/activity synchronization: based on time and based on event.

mal:field.name: triggerName
mal:field.comment: The name of the synchronization. A start time or event, for example.

mal:field.name: timeTrigger
mal:field.comment: Time related synchronization structure. Exactly one of 'timeTrigger' or 'eventTrigger' may be specified, the other is null.

mal:field.name: eventTrigger
mal:field.comment: Event related synchronization structure. Exactly one of 'timeTrigger' or 'eventTrigger' may be specified, the other is null.

mal:field.name: repeat
mal:field.comment: The number of times the trigger is repeated, if applicable. If unspecified, the value is assumed to be 1. 0 is not allowed. It can be specified for any start time specification. If specified the operation will be created first at the start time and then (repeat - 1) times separated by the 'separation' time.

mal:field.name: separation
mal:field.comment: This is mandatory only if the value in the 'repeat' field is specified. This is used to specify the separation between repeated occurrences of a triggered operation.

mal:field.name: earliestOffset
mal:field.comment: The offset of the start of the time window for the operation. This field is mandatory if a latestOffset is provide and if specified, its value must be zero or negative.

mal:field.name: latestOffset
mal:field.comment: The offset of the end of the time window for the operation. This field is mandatory if an earliestOffset is provided and if specified, its value must be zero or positive.

mal:composite.name: TimeTrigger
mal:composite.comment: The TimeTrigger structure holds the time based synchronization information related to tasks and activities. An example is a task or activity start time.

mal:field.name: absoluteTime
mal:field.comment: Absolute time of the trigger in millisecond precision.

mal:field.name: relativeTime
mal:field.comment: Relative time of the trigger in millisecond precision.

mal:composite.name: EventTrigger
mal:composite.comment: The EventTrigger structure holds the event based synchronization information related to tasks and activities. An example is a task or activity start, that is bound to some event occurrence. An example start time could be T(start) = T(eventId, eventCount) + delta + (propagationFactor x propagation delay).

mal:field.name: eventId
mal:field.comment: An alphanumeric event mnemonic relative to which the event trigger is specified. If the eventCount field is specified, it will be combined with the eventId to identify a single instance of an event. If startEventCount and endEventCount are not specified then all events with the eventId will be referenced - an operation will be triggered at the event time + specified delta for every occurrence of this event. If 'repeat' is specified in TriggerDetails, then repeat operations will be created for each occurrence of the event.

mal:field.name: baseEventDefinition
mal:field.comment: The event type relative to which the event trigger is synchronized. The event is a COM object. The events are not standardized as part of the planning request service.

mal:field.name: everyOccurrence
mal:field.comment: If 'true' the is started on every occurrence of the event type.

mal:field.name: startEventCount
mal:field.comment: The trigger is started on the specified count of the event occurrence.

mal:field.name: endEventCount
mal:field.comment: The trigger is ended on the specified count of the event occurrence.

mal:field.name: eventCount
mal:field.comment: The trigger is repeated for the specified count after startEventCount.

mal:field.name: delta
mal:field.comment: An offset time to the event. The default value is 0.

mal:field.name: propagationFactor
mal:field.comment: The value of a factor by which to multiply the propagation delay. A positive number will add multiples of the delay to the time, a negative number will subtract. The default value is 0.

mal:composite.name: RelativeTime
mal:composite.comment: The RelativeTime structure is used to store relative time attributes. It represents a relative date and time to millisecond resolution. This structure wraps MAL:Time, which represents absolute date and time.

mal:field.name: relativeTime
mal:field.comment: The absolute value of the relative time.

mal:field.name: signPositive
mal:field.comment: The sign of the relative time. If true then positive, if false then negative.

mal:enumeration.name: InstanceState
mal:enumeration.comment: Status constants that may be used for planning requests, tasks, schedules, procedures.

mal:enumeration.name: TriggerName
mal:enumeration.comment: TriggerName is an enumeration holding the names of task or activity synchronization. Examples are start, uplink. The synchronization names in the example may be time or event based.

mal:item.comment: The start of a task or activity.
The end of a task or activity.
The earliest start of a task or activity.
The latest start of a task or activity.
The latest end of a task or activity.
The release of a task or activity.
The uplink of a task or activity.
The start of a validity window.
The end of a validity window.
